channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Richard Branson says it’s ‘very sad’ when people measure wealth as success and finds being called a billionaire ‘insulting’
item.description: "Maybe in America, ‘billionaire’ is a sign of success, but that rankles me,” Richard Branson, who has an estimated net worth of $2.6 billion, said.

item.title: Peloton CEO Barry McCarthy to step down, company to lay off 15% of staff
item.description: Peloton announced Thursday that CEO Barry McCarthy will be stepping down just over two years after he took over from founder John Foley.

item.title: Puig is poised for a $15 billion IPO, but CEO Marc Puig has a ‘self-disempowerment’ plan to stop his family from controlling the Spanish beauty empire
item.description: CEO Marc Puig thinks setting "difficult filters" even for family members is the best way to practice "meritocracy."

item.title: Wayfair's losses narrow by more than $100 million after layoffs, even as sales dip
item.description: Wayfair's sales fell in the first quarter, but the furniture retailer narrowed its losses by over $100 million after cutting 13% of its staff.

item.title: AI boom still running hot as SK Hynix says its already sold majority of its 2025 allotment of high-bandwidth memory chips
item.description: Comments from CEO of SK Hynix, the world's second largest memory chipmaker, suggest the shortage of AI-related chips isn't ending anytime soon.

item.title: Moderna loses less than expected as Covid vaccine sales beat estimates, cost cuts take hold
item.description: The company reiterated its full-year 2024 sales guidance of roughly $4 billion, which includes revenue from the expected launch of its RSV vaccine.

item.title: To compete with Asia's rising dominance, French billionaire Bollore wants to build an EV battery plant in France
item.description: Vincent Bollore, CEO of investment group Bollore, is “actively working” on developing the plant with a goal of opening it by 2030.

item.title: Thursday's analyst calls: Discount retailers upgraded, more good news for Carvana, tough outlook for CVS
item.description: This is CNBC Pro's live coverage of Thursday's analyst calls and Wall Street chatter.

item.title: ‘Time is running out’ to build more electric truck chargers in Europe
item.description: Daimler Truck, Volkswagen’s Traton, and Volvo are planning to spend $534 million to install at least 1,700 chargers in Europe.

item.title: World's largest olive oil producer says the industry faces one of its toughest moments ever
item.description: Spain's Deoleo says the industry must undergo a "profound transformation" as it grapples with one of the most challenging moments in its history.
